references.reference: Michael Everson and Charles Riley: Revised proposal for encoding the Bassa Vah script in the SMP of the UCS. ISO/IEC JTC1/SC2/WG2 N3847 L2/10-217. July 31, 2010. Page 1: â€œVowels in Bassa Vah are written as letters with obligatory diacritical marks which indicate the tone of the vowel. [...] the tone is obligatory (a Bassa word is misspelled without it)â€œ

Michael Everson and Charles Riley: Revised proposal for encoding the Bassa Vah script in the SMP of the UCS. ISO/IEC JTC1/SC2/WG2 N3847 L2/10-217. July 31, 2010. Page 1: â€œ[T]he un-marked vowels are never used alone, except in discussions of the alphabet itself.â€œ

Michael Everson and Charles Riley: Revised proposal for encoding the Bassa Vah script in the SMP of the UCS. ISO/IEC JTC1/SC2/WG2 N3847 L2/10-217. July 31, 2010. Page 2: â€œThe Latin FULL STOP may be used, but a Bassa Vah COMMA and FULL STOP are both found in fonts.â€œ
